DIV1.P: AN EXPLANATION OF THE ARMS OF THE SEVERAL INCORPORATED COMPANIES IN THE TOWN AND COUNTY OF NEW CASTLE UPON TYNE.
According to GUILM, BAILEY, and others.
PUBLISHED FOR THE SUBSCRIBERS TO THE PLAT.
BY W. WHITEHEAD, AND T. JAMESON.
NEWCASTLE: PRINTED BY ANGUS, ROBSON AND CO. FOR THE AUTHORS. MDCCLXXVI.

DIV1.HEAD: TO THE RIGHT WORSHIPFUL CHARLES ATKINSON, ESQ MAYOR, CHRISTOPHER FAWCETT, ESQ RECORDER,

LIST.HEAD: ALDERMEN.
LIST.ITEM: SIR WALTER BLACKETT, BART. M. P.
SIR MATT. WHITE RIDLEY, BART. M. P.

LIST.HEAD: COMMON-COUNCIL.
LIST.ITEM: AND THE REST OF OUR WORTHY SUBSCRIBERS.

CLOSER.SIGNED:
THIS WORK IS HUMBLY INSCRIBED, BY THEIR MOST OBEDIENT, AND MUCH OBLIGED, HUMBLE SERVANTS,
WILLIAM WHITEHEAD.
THOMAS JAMESON.

DIV1.HEAD: SUBSCRIBERS NAMES.

LIST.ITEM: John Barber, attorney at law ditto
William Cuthbert, attorney at law ditto
* William Dixon, baker and brewer ditto
George Longstaff, attorney at law ditto
† Michael Shevill, baker and brewer ditto
† William Wilkinson, attorney at law ditto

DIV1.P: Those marked thus*, or thus†, are Free Bur∣gesses.

DIV1.HEAD: ADVERTISEMENT.
DIV1.P: AT the request of several of our friends we compiled this Pamphlet, in order that the Arms might be more easily understood, particularly by those who may not be well ac∣quainted with the copious science of heraldry.

If any of our subscribers should find fault at our not adding supporters to the arms, the answer is this, some companies have them, and a number have not, we, therefore, thought the plate would look more uniform by leaving them intirely out; and hope they will be candid enough to excuse the omission. We next refer them to the bottom of the Plate, where they will find the following rules observed in heral∣dry engraving examplified, so that they will be enabled to know the proper colouring of each arms.
I. OR, denotes gold, or yellow; and is ex∣prest in engraving by small dots, or pricks, all over the shield, or bearing: of precious stones, it represents the topaz; of the planets, the Sun.
II. ARGENT, denotes silver, or white, and is expressed in engraving by the whiteness of the paper, without any strokes upon it: of the planets, it represents the moon; of precious stones, the pearl.
III. AZURE, denotes blue, and is expressed in engraving by lines drawn across the shield: of the planets it represents Venus and Jupiter; of precious stones, the Turkey stone; of metals, tin.

IV. GULES, denotes red, and is expressed in engraving by perpendicular lines from the top of the shield to the bottom: of the planets; it represents Mars; of precious stones, the ruby; of metals, copper.

V. VERT, denotes green, and is expressed in engraving by diagonal lines drawn from one corner of the shield to the other: of the planets, it represents Mercury; of precious stones, the emerald; of metals, quick-silver.
VI. SABLE, denotes black, and is expressed in engraving by lines closely drawn across each other: of planets, it represents Saturn; of precious stones, the diamond; of metals lead and iron.

DIV1.HEAD: EXPLANATION, &c.
ARMS OF THE TOWN AND COUNTY OF NEWCASTLE UPON TYNE.
DIV1.P: GULES, three Castles, Argent; the Crest is out of the Battlement of a Castle, Argent, a Demy-Lion rampant, Or, sustaining a Flag with St George's Gross: The Supporters are two Sea-Horses, Argent.

DIV2.HEAD: MERCHANTS.
DIV2.P: They bear Nebule of six Pieces, Argent and Azure, on a Chief quarterly, Or and Gules; in the first and fourth two red Roses; and in the second and third a Lion of England.
CREST — A flying Pegasus, Argent.
MOTTO— God is our Friend.
They have a spacious and elegant Court eastward from the Guildhall.

DIV2.HEAD: SKINNERS AND GLOVERS.
DIV2.P: Their Coat-Armour is Ermine on a Chief, Gules, three Crowns, Or, with Caps thereunto of the first.
CREST —A Leopard proper, gorg'd with a Chaplet of Bays, Or.
MOTTO —To God only be all glory.
This Company has been highly enobled by having of their Society six Kings, five Queens, one Prince, nine Dukes, two Earls, and one Lord. Their Hall is at the west Corner of the Fryers.

DIV2.HEAD: TAYLORS.
DIV2.P: Beareth Argent, a Tent Royal between two Parliament-Robes, Gules, lined Ermine, on a Chief, Azure, a Lion passant gardant, Or.
CREST—A holy Lamb in Glory proper.
MOTTO—Concordia parvae res crescunt.
This Company hath also been dignified by having of their Fraternity eight Kings, eleven Dukes, thirty Earls, and forty-four Lords.— Their Hall is situate at the Head of Manor-chair.

DIV2.HEAD: BAKERS AND BREWERS
DIV2.P: Their Arms are quarterly; first and fourth, Gules, a Hand issuing out of the Clouds proper, holding a Ballance, an Anchor in a Chief, barry wavy, Or and Azure, on a Cheveron, Or, be∣tween three Garbs; and second and third, Gules, on a Cheveron, Argent, between three Pair of Garbs Saltirewise, Or, three Tuns or Barrels, Sable.
CREST—A Demi Virgin cross barr'd, Gules, holding in each Hand three Heads of Wheat proper.
MOTTO— In God is all our trust.
Their Hall is at the north Corner of the Fryers.

DIV2.HEAD: TANNERS.
DIV2.P: They bear Argent, an Oak Tree proper, on a Chief, Azure, between two Vats wavy, Ar∣gent and Azure, a Bull's Face, Gules.
CREST—A Bull's Head erased.
MOTTO—Deus noster refugium.
Their Hall is on the east of the Fryers.

DIV2.HEAD: CORDWAINERS.
DIV2.P: They bear Azure, a Cheveron, Or, between three Goats Heads erased, Argent, attired of the second.
CREST—A Goat's Head erased, Argent.
They have an elegant Hall at the Foot of the Fleshmarket, fronting towards St Nicholas's Church.

DIV2.HEAD: SADLERS.
DIV2.P: They bear Azure, a Cheveron between three Saddles, Or.
CREST—A Horse proper, bridled and sad∣led, Or.
Their Hall is on the west Side of the Fryers.

DIV2.HEAD: BUTCHERS.
DIV2.P: They bear Azure, two Axes in saltire, Or, headed proper, between three Bulls Heads couped, Argent, armed, Or; on a Chief of the fourth, a Boar's Head couped, Gules, between two Garbs of the fifth.
CREST—A wing'd Bull, proper.
MOTTO—Sic subjecisti sub pedibus oves et boves.
Their Hall is on the south Side of the Fryers.

DIV2.HEAD: SMITHS.
DIV2.P: They bear Sable, a Cheveron between three Hammars, Argent, handled and crowned, Or.
CREST—A Phoenix firing herself by the Sun Beams, all proper.
MOTTO—By hammar and hand, all arts do stand.
They have an elegant Hall the east Corner of the Fryers.

DIV2.HEAD: FULLERS AND DYERS.
DIV2.P: Beareth Sable, a Cheveron ingrailed, between three Madder-Baggs, Argent, corded, Or.
MOTTO—Da gloriam Deo.
Their Hall is on the east Corner of the Fryers.

DIV2.HEAD: MASTERS AND MARINERS.
DIV2.P: They bear Argent, from a Chief, Sable, an Anchor pendant, the Timber or Cross Piece thereof Or.
CREST —The Hull of a Ship, having only a Main-mast and top, without any tackling, Or.
MOTTO—Deus dabit vela.
They have a grand Hall and Chappel in Tri∣nity-Yard.

ITEM.HI: Mr Henry Shadforth, jun. Elder Assistants.

DIV2.HEAD: WEAVERS.
DIV2.P: They bear Azure, on a Cheveron, Argent, be∣tween three Leopard's Heads, having each a Shuttle in his Mouth, Or, as many Rosses, Gules, seeded proper.
CREST—A Leopard's Head, crowned with a ducal Coronet, and a Shuttle as before.
MOTTO—Weave truth with trust.
Their Hall is at the highermost End of the Carliol Croft.

DIV2.HEAD: BARBER-SURGEONSThe Tallow Chandlers are incorporated in this company..
DIV2.P: They bear for their Coat-Armour, divided by St George's Cross, thereon a Lion of England, quarterly, the first and fourth Sable, a Cheveron between three Fleams, Argent; the second and third per pale, Argent and vert, a Rose, Gules, crowned and seeded, Or.
CREST—A Griffin, proper wing'd, Or.
MOTTO—De prescientia Dei.
They have a large and most beautiful Hall on the east of the Freemen's Hospital, overlook∣ing to the South, a delightful Garden, adorned with several Statues.

DIV2.HEAD: SHIPWRIGHTS.
DIV2.P: They bear Noah's Ark on a Chief, the Cross of St George charged with a Lion of England.
CREST.—The said Ark and the Dove, Volant, with an Olive Branch in its Mouth, proper.
They have a large and convenient Hall at the Head of the Walk-Knolls, called the Carpen∣ter's Tower.

DIV2.HEAD: COOPERS.
DIV2.P: They bear Girony of eight, Sable and Gules, on a Cheveron between three Annulets, Or, Croze between two Axes, Sable, on a Chief, Vert, three Lillies proper.
CREST—An Eagle wing'd, surmounted on a Torce.
Their Hall is on the west of the Guildhall.

DIV2.HEAD: HOUSE-CARPENTERS.
DIV2.P: They bear Argent, a Cheveron ingrailed be∣tween three Pair of Compasses, (pointing to∣ward the Base, and a little extended) Sable.
Their Hall is over the Westgate.

DIV2.HEAD: MASONS.
DIV2.P: Their Arms are, Azure, on a Chevron be∣tween three Castles, Argent, a Pair of Compas∣ses, somewhat extended of the first.
CREST—A Castle of the second.
MOTTO—In the Lord is all our Trust.
They have a beautiful Hall on the east Side of the Carliol Croft.

DIV2.HEAD: JOINERS.
DIV2.P: They bear Gules, a Chevron Argent, between two Pair of Compasses above, and a Sphere in Base, Or, on a Chief of the third; two Rosses of the first, and between them a pale Sable char∣ged with an Escallop-Shell of the second.
CREST—A Demi Savage proper, holding a Spear, Or.
MOTTO—In God is all our Trust.
They have an elegant Hall over Pilgrim-Gate.

DIV2.HEAD: MILLERS.
DIV2.P: They bear Argent, a Chevron, Or, between three Mill-Picks, Sable.
They have no Hall, but generally meet at a Tavern.

DIV2.HEAD: FELTMAKERS AND CURRIERSThe Armourers are incorporated with this Com∣pany..
DIV2.P: Their Arms are party per pale; on the first Argent, in Chief a Hat Sable, in Base a Hand proper, between two Hatbands, Azure: The second is Sable, a Cross ingrail'd, Or, between four Pair of Shares in saltire, Argent.
CREST—Two Arms, the Hands holding a Shave.
MOTTO—Spes Nostra Deus.

DIV2.HEAD: PAVIOURS.
DIV2.P: They bear Argent, on a Chevron, Sable, two Picks, Or, between three Gads of Steal of the second.
CREST—A Beater proper.
MOTTO—Let brotherly love continue.
Their Hall is on the Walls as above.

DIV2.HEAD: SLATERS.
DIV2.P: Are Azure, a Chevron, Argent between three latheing Hammars handled, Or, headed proper.
CREST—A Hand holding a Trowel, proper.
MOTTO—Our trust is in God.
They meet in the same Hall as the Coopers.

DIV2.HEAD: PLUMBERS.
DIV2.P: They bear, Or, on a Chevron between a mal∣let Sable, and two Plummets Azure in chief, and a Level of the second in Base, two soldering Irons in Saltire, between a cutting Knife and a Shave Hook, Argent.
CREST—Justice with a Sword in her right Hand and a Balance in the left, standing on a Fountain of the fourth, where are the Words Justitia Pax.
MOTTO—In God is all our Hope.

DIV2.HEAD: PEWTERERS.
DIV2.P: Are Azure, on a Chevron, Or, between three cross Bars, Argent, as many Rosses, Gules.
CREST—Two Arms holding a Pewter Dish, proper.
MOTTO—In God is all my Trust.

DIV2.HEAD: GLAZIERS.
DIV2.P: They bear Argent, two grosing Irons, sal∣tirewise, between four closing Nails, Sable, on a Chif, Gules, a Lion of England.
CREST—A Lion's Head, erased, Or, between two Wings, Azure.
MOTTO—Lucem tuam da nobis o Deum.
These three last Companies are incorporated in one, and have an elegant Hall on the Walls, leading from the Westgate to St Andrew's Church.

DIV2.HEAD: HOASTMEN.
DIV2.P: We could find no Arms for this Company, (although it was established by Royal Charter). But in their Place, is an Engraving from their Seal, which we had the Favour of taking off from the Original: It appears to be a Magistra∣tical Personage in his Gown, greeting a Brother of the Fraternity; from his Mouth is a Label, “Welcome My Oste," and round the Margin, The Seal of the Fraternity of the Ostemen of the Town and County of Newcastle upon ”Tyne.
They meet in the Mayor's-Chamber adjoin∣ing to the Guildhall.

DIV2.HEAD: DRAPERS.
DIV2.P: Their Armorial Ensigns are three Clouds ra∣diated proper, each adorned with a treble Crown, Or.
CREST—A Lamb lodged, as the second, attired.
MOTTO—To God only be Honour and Glory.

DIV2.HEAD: BRICKLAYERS, &c.
DIV2.P:
They bear party per pale, the first Azure, a Chevron, Or, between a Flower de luce, Argent,
between two Brick-Axes, in Chief, and a Bundle of Laths in Base, Or. The second is Azure, on a Chevron ingrailed, between a Trowl and two Hatchets, handled of the second, headed, Argent in Chief, and a treble Brush in Base pro∣per a Rose, Gules, seeded, Or, between two Flowers de luce of the first.
CRESTS—The first an Arm and Hand holding a Brick Axe, Or, The second an Arm and Hand holding a Hatchet proper.
MOTTO—In God is all our Trust.
They are incorporated with the Wallers and Plaisterers, and have an elegant Hall over the Postern-Gate.

DIV2.HEAD: ROPE-MAKERS.
DIV2.P: They bear Argent, between a Chevron Azure, Three Rope Hooks, Sable.
Their Hall is at the Foot of the Carliol Croft.

DIV2.HEAD: SAIL-MAKERS.
DIV2.P: We could find no Armorial Ensigns for this Company.

DIV2.HEAD: UPHOLSTERERS, STATIONERS, &c.
DIV2.P: Their Arms are party per pale, the first Sa∣ble, three Tents Ermine, a Holy Lamb, Ar∣gent, Couchant on a Pillow, Or; The second, Sable, on a Chevron between three Bibles, Or a Falcon rising between two Roses, Gules, seeded of the second, in Chief, a Dove sur∣rounded with a Glory proper.
Their Hall is adjoining to the Guildhall.

DIV2.HEAD: SCRIVENERS.
DIV2.P: They bear Azure, an Eagle with Wings ex∣panded holding in his Mouth a Penner and Ink-Horn, standing on a Book closed, all Or.
Their Hall is adjoining to the Guildhall.

DIV2.HEAD: GOLDSMITHS.
DIV2.P: Their Arms are Quarterly, Gules and Azure, in the first and fourth a Leopard's Head, Or, in the second and third, a Cup covered between two Buckles of the last.
CREST—A Lady holding in her right Hand a Ballance, (with her Arm extended proper) in the left a Touchstone of the third.
MOTTO—To God only be all Glory.
Their Hall is in the Painter-Heugh.

DIV2.HEAD: SPURRIERS.
DIV2.P: Their Arms are Or, on a Fess, Gules, be∣tween two Spurs in Chief, pointing towards the Base proper, and two Horses Heads era∣sed, Argent, a Rose between two Mascles of the third.
CREST—A Spur pointing upwards, Ar∣gent.
They meet in the Long-Room at the Black-Boy, in the Groat-Market.
